node.title: Great Barrier Reef facing another severe bleaching event ahead of UN visit
node.description: The Great Barrier Reef is being hit with another bleaching event, a day before a UN delegation is due to assess the health of the world heritage area.

node.title: More Americans are leaving full-time jobs for freelance work
node.description: For those with the right skills, contract work can offer flexibility — and even six-figure incomes.

node.title: Cheers! Metaverse hits peak hype with virtual beer
node.description: Brewer's launch highlights the extent businesses will go to to join the latest bandwagon.

node.title: Russia blasted at UN for spreading bioweapons 'nonsense' over Ukraine
node.description: The US and Western allies have slammed Russia for spreading propaganda, alleging parts of biological weapons are being made in Ukraine.

node.title: Councils pass check on building consent systems
node.description: The latest official check on the country's councils says most have good policies, procedures and systems.

node.title: Climate change: Wildfire smoke linked to Arctic melting
node.description: The dense plumes of wildfire smoke seen in recent years are contributing to the warming of the Arctic, say scientists.

node.title: Most surgery deferred in capital as rising numbers of staff hit by Covid-19
node.description: Most non-urgent operations in the Wellington region have been cancelled this week due to high numbers of hospital staff falling sick with Covid-19 or being forced to isolate.

node.title: How one driver averages more than 80 miles per gallon as gas prices increase
node.description: The high price of gas has led some drivers to master the art of fuel efficiency.

node.title: Man released in in Nazanin deal back in Iran jail
node.description: Morad Tahbaz's family say they are "distraught" after hoping he would be permanently freed.

node.title: U.S. military plane crashes with four on board in Norway, Norwegian government says
node.description: The fate of the people on board is not known.

node.title: Florida and Alabama report damage as severe storm system moves up East Coast
node.description: The storm system is expected to move up the East Coast, reaching northern New England by the end of the weekend, according to the NWS.

node.title: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," March 20, 2022
node.description: Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin III and Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell join us for exclusive interviews this Sunday on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" this Sunday.

node.title: People — and pets — flee war in Ukraine
node.description: From dogs and cats to goats and bunnies, the pets of Ukraine are on the move along with people who love them.

node.title: NZ Army veteran travels to Ukraine to train volunteer fighters
node.description: A New Zealand Army veteran has joined the ranks of Westerners who travelled to Ukraine to train volunteers in how to hold and shoot a gun as the war wages on. Audio

node.title: US warns China not to fuel Russia's assault on Ukraine
node.description: US President Joe Biden has warned Chinese leader Xi Jinping of "consequences" if Beijing gives material support to Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the White House said.

node.title: Lab science leader concerned at pharmacy test for antibodies
node.description: An expert is raising concern over a device set to be launched in pharmacies which aims to measure how protected people are against Covid-19 infection. Audio

node.title: 'Warmest welcome you can imagine' - PM opens doors to tourists
node.description: The Prime Minister has gone on a marketing blitz to reel Australians to our shores. Audio

node.title: National calls for phasing out of most Covid-19 restrictions
node.description: The National Party is calling for the immediate end of most vaccine passes and a shorter Covid-19 isolation period, saying it is time for New Zealand to "move on".

node.title: Kentucky and Iowa losses blow out millions of March Madness brackets
node.description: Billions of dollars were wagered on this year's March Madness tourney -- and millions of bettors have already lost.

node.title: Buyers return to ARMs as mortgage rates jump above 4%
node.description: With rates at their highest point since 2019, some buyers are turning to adjustable-rate mortgages for affordability.

node.title: Ex-police officer and lawmaker plead guilty in Capitol riot
node.description: Jacob Fracker, who has agreed to cooperate with federal prosecutors, was fired from his job as a police officer in Rocky Mount, Virginia while Derrick Evans resigned from the West Virginia state legislature before the session started.

node.title: Young brothers found in Amazon after nearly four weeks
node.description: Two young indigenous boys rescued after almost four weeks lost in Brazil's Amazon rainforest have been found and taken to hospital.

node.title: 'It's not so great now' - Millions tested in Shanghai Covid surge
node.description: The Chinese commercial hub of Shanghai is pushing ahead with a mass testing initiative as it tries to curb a new spike in Covid-19 infections, but some districts were easing lockdown rules in an…

node.title: Botox maker AbbVie suspends operations in Russia
node.description: Drugmakers are freezing some activities in Russia while continuing to provide life-saving medicines.

node.title: Superb cricket at the World Cup, despite White Ferns' crushing losses
node.description: Opinon - It's been no fun watching the White Ferns wilt at their home Cricket World Cup, but overall there's been some superb cricket, writes Hamish Bidwell.

node.title: Fast-food chains find breaking up with Russia is hard to do
node.description: Burger King and Papa John's are among the quick-serve restaurants struggling to extricate their brands from Russia.

node.title: At least 5 killed in massive crash involving 20 tractor-trailers
node.description: Officials are still investigating the number of people injured.

node.title: National Guard shoots down "false" Russian report about U.S. troops in Ukraine
node.description: In a statement on Thursday, the National Guard said not only was the report "false," but that the soldiers named in the report were not even in Ukraine.

node.title: U.S. gas prices ease back from record high
node.description: Prices at the pump now average $4.27 per gallon, down 6 cents from their peak last week.

node.title: Coroner releases findings into five homicides committed by mentally ill people
node.description: A coroner who investigated five deaths in the Wellington region has made dozens of recommendations about the mental health care provided to the people responsible.
